flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500.0>>500.0 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=2.5>>2.5 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500.0*$.2.5=$1250.0<<500.0*2.5=1250.0>>1250.0 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500.0*$.0.5=$250.0<<500.0*0.5=250.0>>250.0 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $1250.0+$250.0=$1500.0<<1250.0+250.0=1500.0>>1500.0 total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 0.25, not 2.5. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
